pr_title: api,netty: fix MethodDescriptor and InternalKnownTransport for netty-shaded

timeline.message: api,netty: fix MethodDescriptor and InternalKnownTransport for netty-shaded

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure if it's possible that the compiler can optimize this contains()?: expression and replace it with InternalKnownTransport.NETTY directly before shadow plugin does its job. My local interop test did not show it happened.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: No, it won't be able to rework this string. You could also just do "shaded" as another option. But all those variations should be fine.
replies.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText: Just "shaded" will produce false positive if grpc as a whole is shaded by the application.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText:
This will break Bazel; use a literal 2.
The comment alludes to why this was done, but even if you thought that no longer applied the comment should have been removed.
timeline.author: ejona86

replies.bodyText: InternalKnownTransport is part of grpc-api so Bazel seems not impacted. It breaks blaze though.
replies.author: dapengzhang0
dapengzhang0
